title: Panics while using a mounted swift
body:
<!--

We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

**STOP and READ**
**YOUR POST WILL BE REMOVED IF IT IS LOW QUALITY**:
Please show the effort you've put in to solving the problem and please be specific.
People are volunteering their time to help! Low effort posts are not likely to get good answers!

If you think you might have found a bug, try to replicate it with the latest beta (or stable).
The update instructions are available at https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_selfupdate/

If you can still replicate it or just got a question then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

for a quick response instead of filing an issue on this repo.

If nothing else helps, then please fill in the info below which helps us help you.

**DO NOT REDACT** any information except passwords/keys/personal info.

You should use 3 backticks to begin and end your paste to make it readable.

Make sure to include a log obtained with '-vv'.

You can also use '-vv --log-file bug.log' and a service such as https://pastebin.com or https://gist.github.com/

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->



#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
While using rclone to mount a swift object storage (from OVH) i got a lot of panics:
```
2021/08/10 14:46:30 fuse: panic in handler for Setattr [ID=0x2d4de Node=0xc92 Uid=0 Gid=0 Pid=31986] size=0 mtime=2021-08-10 14:46:30.536098396 +0000 UTC handle=INVALID-0x0 lockowner: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
goroutine 218215 [running]:
bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).serve.func2(0x21a98b8, 0xc001465dc0, 0xc0019b0ed8, 0xc0019b0e06)
	bazil.org/fuse@v0.0.0-20200524192727-fb710f7dfd05/fs/serve.go:994 +0x19e
panic(0x1b21100, 0x2da1b00)
	runtime/panic.go:965 +0x1b9
github.com/rclone/rclone/vfs.(*File).Truncate(0xc000c97380, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
	github.com/rclone/rclone/vfs/file.go:765 +0x266
github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount.(*File).Setattr(0xc000ccb940, 0x21b9ed0, 0xc00080e2c0, 0xc001465dc0, 0xc001440be0, 0xc00148ac01, 0x50)
	github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd/mount/file.go:57 +0x265
bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).handleRequest(0xc000787340, 0x21b9ed0, 0xc00080e2c0, 0x2186f80, 0xc000ccb940, 0xc001260800, 0x21a98b8, 0xc001465dc0, 0xc0019b0ed8, 0x1, ...)
	bazil.org/fuse@v0.0.0-20200524192727-fb710f7dfd05/fs/serve.go:1082 +0x2e48
bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).serve(0xc000787340, 0x21a98b8, 0xc001465dc0)
	bazil.org/fuse@v0.0.0-20200524192727-fb710f7dfd05/fs/serve.go:1015 +0x390
bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve.func1(0xc000787340, 0x21a98b8, 0xc001465dc0)
	bazil.org/fuse@v0.0.0-20200524192727-fb710f7dfd05/fs/serve.go:512 +0x6f
created by bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve
	bazil.org/fuse@v0.0.0-20200524192727-fb710f7dfd05/fs/serve.go:510 +0x354
```

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.56.0
- os/version: debian 8.8 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 3.16.0-4-amd64 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.16.5
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
```
root@dev:~# cat /etc/os-release
PRETTY_NAME="Debian GNU/Linux 8 (jessie)"
NAME="Debian GNU/Linux"
VERSION_ID="8"
VERSION="8 (jessie)"
ID=debian
HOME_URL="http://www.debian.org/"
SUPPORT_URL="http://www.debian.org/support"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.debian.org/"
```


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
OVH 


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
It's a mounted fs with this command:
```
rclone mount remote:data/ /home/test/ --vfs-cache-mode=full --allow-non-empty --allow-other --dir-cache-time 5m --no-modtime --retries 3 --vfs-cache-max-size 1G --write-back-cache --attr-timeout 5s
```




<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
